required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 3DV+TPS Applied to Radiotherapy for Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: 3DV+TPS Applied to Radiotherapy for Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma - a Randomized, Single-blind, Multi-center Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: Verify that 3DV+TPS is non-inferior compared to existing imported TPS and superior to existing domestic TPS.

detailed_description.textblock: The main purpose of the study was to verify that 3DV+TPS is non-inferior compared to existing imported TPS and superior to existing domestic TPS. A total of 100 patients were enrolled. The primary endpoint of the study was the objective response rate (ORR), and the secondary endpoint was the local control rate and the incidence of treatment-related side effects.

primary_outcome.description: Objective Remission Rate (ORR) is equal to complete remission (CR) + partial remission (PR)

secondary_outcome.description: Local control means that the tumor does not increase in imaging, but if the tumor does not increase, the patient with increased symptoms after treatment is not included in the local control range.
Incidence of related side effects during disease treatment

arm_group.description: Use 3DV+TPS to map targets and develop treatment plans. The intervention is 3DV+TPS and VARIAN.
Use imported Varian TPS to map targets and develop treatment plans.
Use 3DV+TPS to map targets and develop treatment plans.
Adopt domestic TPS hook target and develop treatment plan.

intervention.description: Use imported 3DV+TPS to map targets and develop treatment plans
Use imported TPS to map targets and develop treatment plans
Use domestic 3DV+TPS to delineate target areas and develop treatment plans
Use domestic TPS to map targets and develop treatment plans

facility.name: the second affiliated hospital of Army medical university
